definition: to start on a journey/to be on one's way
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: Gur said, pointing out toward the road.
To get myself to actually do, my favorite trick is the 50 minutes rule.
sentences.chinese: 努力让自己上路，我的锦囊妙计是50分钟法则。

sentences.english: At huge risk, Henson and his wife set off with their four children.
sentences.chinese: 亨森和妻子冒着极大的风险带着四个孩子上路了。

sentences.english: We started our trip at dawn in order to get there before noon.
sentences.chinese: 为了在午前到达该处，我们黎明即动身上路。

sentences.english: At some point, your gut tells you to launch.
sentences.chinese: 在某一刻，你的内心告诉自己得上路了。

sentences.english: We have had a lovely evening, but it is time we hit the road.
sentences.chinese: 一今晚我们过得很愉快，伹是该上路了。

sentences.english: She shouldered her rucksack and set off along the road.
sentences.chinese: 她背起帆布背包就上路了。

sentences.english: You Lan's backdrop, the moon, such as silver plate, as quoted in Sheung us.
sentences.chinese: 幽蓝的天幕上，明月如银盘，引我们上路。

sentences.english: Tiro snow mushroom sky had better not drive to set out.
sentences.chinese: 新手雪天最好不要开车上路。

sentences.english: Well I'd better get on the road. I'll write again further on.
sentences.chinese: 好了我该上路了，我会继续写下去的。

sentences.english: They always put on long-sleeve clothes when going out.
sentences.chinese: 一般出门上路，都会穿长袖的衣服。

sentences.english: This freshman from Huilai, Guangdong, was traveling alone for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 这位来自广东惠来县的大学新生还是第一次独自上路。

sentences.english: At this moment , a night bird is leading the poet setting off along ta warm road, warm amniotic fluids .
sentences.chinese: 此刻夜鸟正引领着诗人上路，一条羊水般温暖的路。

sentences.english: We set off at a canter .
sentences.chinese: 我们驱马慢跑开始上路。

sentences.english: He fastened the car door, climbed to his own seat outside, and we set off.
sentences.chinese: 他关了车门，爬到车外自己的位置上，我们便上路了。

sentences.english: Monsieur le Maire must consent to travel in a little tilbury that I own.
sentences.chinese: 市长先生必须同意，用我的那辆小车上路。

definition: person/number of people/(per) capita/(a person's) head/(Tw) person whose identity is used by sb else (e.g. to create a bogus account)
to arrest/to capture/to seize/to win (a set, a game etc)
matching/fitting in with/compatible with/to correspond/to fit/to conform to/rapport/to coordinate with/to act in concert with/to cooperate/to become man and wife/to combine parts of machine
(sitting) opposite/across (the street)/directly in front/to be face to face
to reduce speed/to slow down/to take it easy
to respond to an assault by killing one's assailant
to be out of (political) office/to be out of power
